title: Information Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Maryville University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is first a phone interview with HR followed by an In person interview with 2-3 other managers or co workers and then follows up with a 3rd with either the manager or VP.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your technical background and experience?

title: Project Manager Interview
Interview Descriptions: Met with hiring manager and leader from another department who I would be working with so that they could get an idea of how well I could interact with other groups.
Interview Questions: It was 4 years ago, and I don't recall the specific questions.

title: Information Technology Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Maryville University
Interview Descriptions: The interview panel was really professional and had a chance to visit the campus and interact  with the team members after the interview process. Presentation was required for the position
Interview Questions: What is like to work in a diverse environment?

title: Professor Interview
Interview Descriptions: Really to the point and simple. It was really engaging and more of a conversation rather than an interview. It was simple and questions was focused on teaching experience. I would definitely recommend.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your teaching experience

title: Lecturer Interview
Interview Descriptions: I completed a typical online application including resume and cover letter.  This was followed by an interview request over email, and then a phone interview. They got back to me about the position in a timely manner following the interview and were willing to provide helpful feedback.
Interview Questions: How would you balance this part-time position with your full-time job.

title: Federal Work Study Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Maryville University in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: Since it was through a federal program, the only interview I had was really just to make sure I understood the parameters of the job I was about to accept.
Interview Questions: What are you hoping to get out of this experience?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Maryville University (Saint Louis, MO) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very easy going and comfortable. They ask you how you would handle certain situations and what your strengths and weaknesses are. They usually get back to you shortly after the interview.
Interview Questions: How would you handle an angry customer/student?

title: Solution Squad Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Maryville University
Interview Descriptions: 30 minute phone screening. If called back, 4 hour in person interview meeting multiple people across campus, HR visit, and 1:1 conversation with potential supervisor.  Total process can take weeks/months.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to multitask

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Maryville University
Interview Descriptions: There was a very fast turn-around time between my phone interview and on-campus interview.  It was a full day, with opportunities to speak with faculty and students.  There was also a demonstration lesson.  Everyone was friendly, knowledgable, and supportive.  Interactions were authentic and geared to ensure that the position would be a good fit for both of us.
Interview Questions: How do you incorporate technology into your teaching?

title: Center Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Maryville University (Saint Louis, MO) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a very relaxed atmosphere. The interviewer was very nice and wanted to know more about myself, past experiences, and why i applied for the job. The questions were not too bad, because i was being myself. I had read on various sites that interviewers can tell when you are being fake no matter how genuine you think you sound. My advise is for you to just be yourself.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Maryville University (Saint Louis, MO) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very casual and laid back. I was interviewed by the three main workers in the department and they asked to see my portfolio. Overall, the interview was about 30 minutes and I received an offer within the following week.
Interview Questions: How would you be able to add and contribute to this department?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Maryville University (Saint Louis, MO) in Jul 2009
Interview Descriptions: Had one interview on phone with Dean.  Then an interview with dean of college of Arts and Sciences and all faculty who peppered me with questions.  Finally one last interview with the Vice President of Academic Affairs.
Interview Questions: Most unexpected question was about how many children I had and how I expected to balance my work load at Maryville with taking care of them.
